resources.string: Simple time-delayed, repeated version of the input, simulating echoes.
A more advanced and thicker-sounding Echo effect.
Short, single echo with minimal delay, adding a sense of space and depth.
A classic, sweeping sound modulation, by mixing the input with a phased copy.
Warbling or wobbling effect that simulates a fluctuation in pitch.
A rich, shimmering sound from multiple modulated copies of the input.
Warm, saturated sound of overdriven tube amplifiers rich with overtones.
Harsh, gritty and distorted sound produced by clipping or saturation.
Series of delayed and phase-shifted copies, producing a comb-like frequency response.
Comb-like frequency response with adjustable feedback and feedforward coefficients.
Similar to FIR, with added Scale modulation.
Adjusts the amplitude or volume level of the audio signal.
Rhythmic modulation of the input amplitude, creating a pulsating or trembling sound.
